title: Rebel left-wing MP Frank Field is rallying Labour ministers to defy Jeremy Corbyn and back Boris l
text:
MP Frank Field is leading a bid to persuade his former Labour colleagues to defy Corbyn and back Boris Johnson's Brexit deal

Veteran Left-wing MP Frank Field is leading a bid to persuade his former Labour colleagues to defy Jeremy Corbyn and back Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal.

Pro-Brexit Mr Field, who quit Labour last year and now sits as an Independent MP for Birkenhead, is organising moves to maximise a potential Labour rebellion supporting Boris Johnson’s plan.

A source close to Mr Field said: ‘I think we’ll get quite a few.’

It comes after reports that up to 30 Labour MPs will defy Mr Corbyn and vote to get a Brexit deal over the line by October 31. Field’s move follows claims that selected Labour MPs in the North and Midlands are be offered ‘Brexit bribes’ of massive Government investment in their constituencies if they back the deal.

One senior Labour Brexiteer and northern MP rejected the claims yesterday and party whips claimed any revolt would be restricted to no more than five – the same number which backed Theresa May’s deal. But The Mail on Sunday understands that Mr Johnson will use the Queen’s Speech to unveil major projects in the North. Sources said the aim would be to tackle the North/South divide with a series of ‘prosperity funds’ for specific regions.

Mr Corbyn (pictured left) is hoping to kill the rebellion aimed at defying him as he claims the Tories wanted ‘a Trump-deal Brexit that would crash our economy'. He insisted that 'no Labour MP could support such a reckless deal'

At conference last week, the Prime Minister reiterated his wish to ‘level up’ all parts of the UK and re-affirmed his backing for a new high-speed rail link between the Manchester and Leeds.

Mr Corbyn has sought to kill any rebellion, claiming the Tories wanted ‘a Trump-deal Brexit that would crash our economy’ and vowing: ‘No Labour MP could support such a reckless deal’.

Mr Field, 77, who cited anti-Semitism and ‘nastiness’ in Labour when he quit the party in 2018 after 58 years, plans to stand as the Birkenhead Social Justice candidate at the next Election.
description: Left-wing MP Frank Field says some Labour MPs in the North and Midlands are being offered 'Brexit Bribes' if they back their party's deal. He is rallying them to Back Boris and up to 30 are to defy Corbyn.
authors: Brendan Carlin For The Mail On Sunday
